image.altText: The entrance to Cranbrook School

props.synopsis: The elite Sydney private school missed two deadlines for answering questions from a parliamentary committee following an ABC investigation into allegations of a toxic culture, workplace bullying and abuse.

title.children: Cranbrook faces losing federal funding for not being 'more cooperative' after abuse and toxic culture claims

image.altText: Composite of Ben Hunt, Tom Dearden and Joseph Sua'ali'i

props.synopsis: The Maroons claim bragging rights after defeating the Blues 38-10 in the State of Origin opener, but their win didn't come without a spot of controversy. Here are five quick hits from State of Origin I in Sydney.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sua'ali'i cops month-long ban as Hunt stands tall for Maroons in Origin I

image.altText: A group of forensics police officers wearing blue overalls outside a home on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A damning report identified more than 170 breaches of the NSW Police Force's own domestic violence procedures, with officers failing to do the basics like seizing guns, taking a statement, or checking CCTV footage.

title.children: Failed to seize guns, grant protection orders or take statements: The DV failures of one police force reflect another

image.altText: A woman in a pink top smiles sadly while looking away slightly, in front of photo wall.

props.synopsis: Naomi Bowden's tear-stained face brought a state inquiry into birth trauma to global attention, but she and other women say the inquiry's final report does not go far enough.

title.children: Naomi's tragic stillbirth story was among 4,000 submissions to birth trauma inquiry. She says its report is 'heartbreaking'

image.altText: Australian passport

props.synopsis: Immigration is a hot issue in the UK and US election campaigns as arrivals surge and voters facing cost-of-living pressure. But reducing migrant numbers has economic consequences too.

title.children: As the US and UK face 'migration elections,' will Australia be next?

image.altText: Jane and John Newson, in their 70s, smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Jane Newson saves for a P&O cruise every year and says it's her chance to see the world when other options are too expensive. The cruise company's surprise exit from Australia after 90 years is the end of an era for her and the national icon.

title.children: Jane's annual cruise was cancelled this week, ending an era for her and the iconic P&O brand

image.altText: Woman looks at the NDIS complaints form online

props.synopsis: The federal government is committing to work further with the disability community to design changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: How will people with disability be involved in designing changes to the NDIS?

image.altText: A white van carrying Armaguard's badge logo stationary in a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Armaguard is facing a new investigation by the competition watchdog, as it comes under intense scrutiny over its troubled monopoly on cash transportation around the country.

title.children: Cash crisis gets messy, with fresh ACCC scrutiny of troubled Armaguard

image.altText: Alex de Minaur, wearing blue tennis gear, clenches his fist after a point at the French Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is out to break a 27-year drought as the Australian takes on German Alexander Zverev in the French Open quarter-final at Roland Garros. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: De Minaur drops the first set to Zverev as they fight for a French Open semi-final spot

image.altText: Two swans in a lake

props.synopsis: A nearly two-decade study of birds living in Melbourne's Albert Park has revealed surprising relationship patterns between black swans.

title.children: Ethically swanogamous: What we can learn about relationships from Melbourne's black swans

image.altText: King Charles holds and hand to his eye as he tears up

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old monarch, who recently resumed public engagements, is expected to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US President Joe Biden in France for the World War II anniversary.

title.children: King Charles heads D-Day's 80th anniversary commemorations before first international trip since cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A woman surrounded by cameras, crying.

props.synopsis: The Italian court found Knox wrongly accused an innocent man, the Congolese owner of the bar where she worked, of the 2007 killing.

title.children: Amanda Knox re-convicted in Italian slander case after prior exoneration for 2007 murder of roommate

image.altText: Justin Stein

props.synopsis: The NSW Supreme Court jury in Justin Stein's trial is hearing a summing up of the case before they are expected to begin deliberating on their verdict on Thursday.

title.children: Charlise Mutten's accused killer changed story at every stage to 'cover his guilt', court told

image.altText: Christina Applegate in a velvet suit holding a cane with other arm being held by Anthony Anderson leading her on stage

props.synopsis: Actor Christina Applegate has opened up on a podcast about feeling down as a result of what she has to deal with day-to-day as someone living with Multiple Sclerosis.

title.children: 'I don't enjoy living': Christina Applegate opens up about depression from Multiple Sclerosis

image.altText: albo bandt dutton

props.synopsis: The government and the opposition have joined together in parliament to condemn Greens members' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests, accusing the party of inflaming tensions over social cohesion.

title.children: 'I will not be lectured about peace and non-violence': Bipartisan condemnation of Greens' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests

image.altText: Two smiling young women, dressed for warmth, stand near a house.

props.synopsis: Overseas travellers and itinerant workers say they were encouraged to travel to Lismore and squat in flood-affected houses via an online network created during a Tasmanian festival.

title.children: Floods have left Lismore a 'ghost town' — now squatters are seeking out its empty homes

image.altText: A middle aged woman with a light brown bob and glasses speaks in front of small microphones mounted on a desk.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia's governor says the federal government's proposed $300 energy bill relief will not have a "material" impact on reducing inflation, but is also unlikely to make inflation worse.

title.children: RBA governor says $300 energy bill relief is unlikely to impact inflation

image.altText: Liz Allen, wearing black floral blazer over navy top, smiles outside in front of a brick wall

props.synopsis: For Pay Day, demographer and social researcher Dr Liz Allen shares the shame that comes with living in poverty, the secrets of survival, and how this experience "grants perspective that can never be bought".

title.children: 'I have shop-lifted to feed my family': Dr Liz Allen on the shame of poverty, and the life lessons it has taught her

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman smiling, looking to the left.

props.synopsis: The social media company said the attack took place through the platform's direct-messaging feature, without sharing further information about the nature of the hack.

title.children: Paris Hilton, CNN among high-profile TikTok accounts targeted in cyber attack

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Sua'ali'i is sent off

props.synopsis: New South Wales' new era gets off to a shocking start, with Joseph Sua'ali'i sent off after just eight minutes following a dramatic high hit on Queensland fullback Reece Walsh in State of Origin Game I at Sydney's Olympic stadium.

title.children: 'Big call in a big game like this': Blues question debutant's dismissal early in Origin thumping

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: A staff survey at ABC News has found bullying is a "pervasive" issue in the workplace, especially for women, who also experience higher rates of sexual harassment at work.

title.children: ABC News staff survey reveals one in four respondents experienced workplace bullying, one in 10 were sexually harrassed

image.altText: An image of a man holding a long black object walking past a bush on a suburban street

props.synopsis: The 57-year-old has pleaded not guilty to the alleged murders of Carol Clay and Russell Hill and will give evidence on Thursday.

title.children: Greg Lynn, accused of murdering two campers, will take the stand in Supreme Court trial

image.altText: A view of sign board warning of extreme heat in Death Valley, California

props.synopsis: As the world hits an alarming climate milestone, a new report by a US research team shows the staggering amount of extreme heat days each country experienced last year, with the majority made more likely by human-induced climate change.

title.children: One country had 18 times more dangerous heat days in a year as the world marks an unfortunate milestone

image.altText: Man smiling and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Singer Kamahl is accused of intimidating a woman over a loan the TV personality's lawyer says he gave her.

title.children: TV personality Kamahl to apply to have intimidation charge dismissed on mental health grounds

image.altText: Australian cricketer Pat Cummins looks lost in thought as he sits at a training session.

props.synopsis: Australia's Test skipper Pat Cummins gives cricket in the United States a huge boost after signing a shock four-year deal with the San Francisco Unicorns.

title.children: Cummins the Unicorn: Australia's Test captain signs shock deal with San Francisco T20 side

image.altText: A black and white photo of Daryl Somers and John Blackman dressed up in suits.

props.synopsis: Radio and television star John Blackman has died at the age of 76. He was well known for his voiceover work on Channel Nine's Hey Hey It's Saturday program.

title.children: Hey Hey host Daryl Somers pays tribute to 'beloved friend' John Blackman after death at 76

image.altText: a man in a suit walking out of a building with a mother and father covering their faces

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old accused of conspiring a terrorist attack against Jewish and Assyrian people is granted bail after a NSW Supreme Court judge finds the Commonwealth's case against him "does not appear strong".

title.children: Judge grants bail to alleged teen terrorist, branding case 'thin' in bruising ruling for AFP

image.altText: Rose Byrne Ruby the Roo

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate staff using $137,000 in taxpayer funds for personal travel expenses.

title.children: Tourism Australia calls in corruption watchdog over expenses scandal

image.altText: Bearded man wearing suit eats apple in front of retro court building.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man representing himself in court over allegations of domestic violence against his then-wife has cross-examined his own psychologist, who first alerted police to the incident.

title.children: Man representing himself in family violence trial bills psychologist for 'fair amount' of $10k an hour

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a school smiling.

props.synopsis: With 38 per cent of Australian students classed as "chronically absent", Alesco Secondary College, in the Hunter region of New South Wales, offers students a flexible approach and an alternative to mainstream schooling.

title.children: As school refusals rise, this college offers students like Emily a creative alternative

image.altText: Glass of orange juice with oranges

props.synopsis: Citrus Australia estimates international orange concentrate imports halved this year as the result of a huge global shortage, and it might see mandarin and even struggling grape growers step up.

title.children: We're going to pay more for OJ in the near future, and we might need grape growers to juice things up

image.altText: A man sits cross-legged on a red couch and looks down at his phone with a serious expression on his face.

props.synopsis: While striking a balance between moderating our exposure and staying informed about the world around us is important, experts say learning to sit with discomfort can lead to growth and resilience.

title.children: 'A sign your humanity is intact': What to do with the feelings distressing Israel-Gaza coverage ignites

image.altText: A screenshot of a man next to a pillar on which toilet has been spray painted.

props.synopsis: A Japanese celebrity plastic surgeon puts a bounty on the head of a Chinese vlogger who sparked outrage by urinating and spray-painting "toilet" at Tokyo's controversial Yasukuni Shrine.

title.children: Plastic surgeon offers $100,000 bounty for man who defaced and urinated on Japanese war shrine

image.altText: Woman throws banana milkshake at man.

props.synopsis: Nigel Farage, who is best known for helping to lead the 2016's successful Brexit campaign, is doused with a milkshake on his first full day of campaigning for a seat in parliament in the July 4 election

title.children: British politician Nigel Farage doused with milkshake while on campaign trail
